intro: Crotalaria glycinea, commonly known as the sicklepod, is an annual herbaceous plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant has distinctive yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, and its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three leaflets. Crotalaria glycinea is known for its toxic seeds, which contain rotenone, a natural insecticide. It is often found in disturbed soils and can be a weed in agricultural fields.
